x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Disaster relief efforts often suffer from inefficient coordination between volunteers, donors, and local authorities, leading to delays and missed opportunities for helping those in need.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The system would include volunteer sign-ups, resource allocation (food, medicine, etc.), and real-time reporting of affected areas. Volunteers would be able to track their assigned tasks, while donors can track how their contributions are being used.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • ServiceNow Incident Management
  • Service Catalog
  • Event Management
  • Mobile App
  • Geolocation integration to track affected areas, mobile capabilities for volunteers, and real-time communication tools.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Real-time data accuracy and consistency could be difficult to achieve in a disaster setting, where infrastructure may be damaged. Ensuring the system works in low-connectivity environments is also a potential challenge.
